answers.answer: The 126 is worrysome, but  it takes more than just 1 test to define you as diabetic.  However you do at least have problems with your BG.What "diet" have you been on, since its carbohydrates that raise BG ! A low fat high carb "diet" just makes the pancreas work harder than it needs too!   and can cause the pancreas to quit working earlier.The diet you need to be on is a low carb diet.

Thank you for your reply!:)I am on a 180 gramm carbohydrate diet, it is low carb diet. But actually i eat less then it because that is too much for me. And i am quite skinny (have a BMI of 16)And i take Eucreas as medicineAnd i have had an OGTT (75 gramm) after my 118.8 mg/dl result and then these were the results.fasting: 115,2 mg/dl1 hour 214.2 mg/dl2 hour  162 mg/dl

180 gr of carbs is a lot of carbs  I eat under 60 a day.My understanding is any BG over 200 is diabetic  your 1 hour is over 200.Time to take the bull by the horn.  reduce carbs exercise get a meter and test before and 1hour after a new meal to see how that meal effected your BG.a  book to read..  Think Like a Pancreas... I forget who wrote itfind an online diabetes forum,  there are plenty around and ask questions.

Eucreas  contains Metformin a very safe and well known drug.  However Eucreas  also contains vildagliptin A drug that the FDA (US drug regulating department) wont allow  vildagliptin in the us as in animal trials it produce's skin leas ions and Kidney impairment.  I would consider going to only Metforman.JMO

Thank you again for the informative replies! :)When i get to see my doctor, i will ask about a possibly new pill, like normal Metformin.And then it seems i also should eat less carbohydrate..i do not know why so much was prescribed for me, maybe because i am too skinny :sThx for the advice for the book!With my 1 hour results from the OGTT i was not sure if the 214.2 mg/dl could mean diabetes because it is above 200, or this is only valid, if it is normal food not the 75 gramm glucose, but then it seems that was also an alerting sign :sGreetings!:)

question: Hi,like 6 weeks ago i had a blood test and my fasting glucose was 118.8 mg/dl 2 weeks later fasting was 115.2 mg/dl.Now 2 weeks ago it was 126.54 mg/dl.(and i am on diet for more then a year and also take medicine).Could these results mean that i developed diabetes?thank you for the reply
title: fasting glucose level question
